intro: Uncasia altissima, commonly known as the tall mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its low-growing, dense shrub form with small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of vibrant purple or pink flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in cool, high-altitude environments with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
